com.github.macgregor.alexandria

Class BatchProcess<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.BatchProcess<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the object being processed

    public class BatchProcess<T>
extends Object
    Generic class to handle wrapping batch processing in robust error handling. This is generally used for processing collections of Config.DocumentMetadata where we want to ensure we process all documents in the collection without losing any exceptions and their execution context. The exception handling is boiler plate that was being duplicated all over, this abstracts it. A batch process has three parts:
    1. collect - call the delegated BatchProcess.Batch.collect(Context) method to collect the objects to process
    2. execute - for each object collected, call the delegated BatchProcess.Task.execute(Context, Object)
    3. after batch - call the delegated BatchProcess.AfterBatch.execute(Context, Collection)
    For example, AlexandriaConvert is implemented roughly as: 
     
 BatchProcess<Config.DocumentMetadata> batchProcess = new BatchProcess<>(context);
 batchProcess.execute(
      context -> { // lambda implemented {@link Batch}
          context.config().metadata().get()
      },
      (context, metadata) -> { // lambda implemented {@link Task}
          AlexandriaConvert.convert(context, metadata);
      },
      (context, exceptions) -> { // lambda implemented {@link AfterBatch}
          Alexandria.save(context);
          return BatchProcess.EXCEPTIONS_UNHANDLED; //delegate exception handling to {@link BatchProcess}
      });
    TODO: Errors thrown during batch processing are currently a bit hard to read. It can be hard to tell exactly where an exception was thrown. This needs to be improved.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BatchProcess.AfterBatch<T>
      Lambda compatible interface that will be called after processing is complete
      static interface  BatchProcess.Batch<T>
      Lambda compatible interface that will collect objects to be processed
      static interface  BatchProcess.Task<T>
      Lambda compatible interface that will process each object returned by BatchProcess.Batch.collect(Context).

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(BatchProcess.Batch<T> batch,
                    BatchProcess.Task<T> task)
             throws BatchProcessException
        Execute the batch, providing a default BatchProcess.AfterBatch that calls Context.save(Context) before throwing any errors that occurred.
        Parameters:
        batch - Batch collection delegate
        task - Task execution delegate
        Throws:
        BatchProcessException - Wrapper containing all exceptions thrown while processing the batch
        See Also:
        execute(Batch, Task, AfterBatch)

      • execute

        public void execute(BatchProcess.Batch<T> batch,
                    BatchProcess.Task<T> task,
                    BatchProcess.AfterBatch<T> after)
             throws BatchProcessException
        Execute the batch wrapping the delegated methods in robust exception handling. This method should guarantee all exceptions thrown, even runtime exceptions are wrapped and thrown as a checked BatchProcessException at the end of processing. This allows as much of the batch to be processed as possible before throwing an error. If a single object has a problem, why fail the whole thing?
        Parameters:
        batch - Batch collection delegate
        task - Task execution delegate
        after - After batch delegate
        Throws:
        BatchProcessException - Wrapper containing all exceptions thrown while processing the batch

      • buildAlexandriaException

        protected AlexandriaException buildAlexandriaException(Throwable cause,
                                                       Optional<T> t,
                                                       Optional<String> message)
        Convenience method to remove some boiler plate from wrapping exceptions.
        Parameters:
        cause - Cause being wrapped
        t - Type of object being processed, if processing Config.DocumentMetadata we add it for debugging context
        message - optional error message
        Returns:
        new exception ready to be thrown
